_88artifact.description: An artifact is the result of a successful build. It represents a built Docker image and will tell what what you need to pull to obtain the image.
_88artifact.title: Artifact

$eref.description: unique identifier of artifact

_88image.description: the name of the Docker image. This can be pulled with `docker pull`

$eref.description: unique identifier of build
the name of the Docker image. This can be pulled with `docker pull`
unique identifier of artifact

_88build.description: A build represents a request to build a git commit for a repo.

$eref.description: the branch within the GitHub repository that the build was triggered from
the GitHub repository that this build is for
the git commit to build

links.description: Create a new build and start it. Note that you cannot start a new build for a sha that is already in a "pending" or "building" state. You should cancel the existing build first, or wait for it to complete. You must specify either a `branch` OR a `sha`. If you provide a `branch` but no `sha`, Conveyor will use the GitHub API to resolve the HEAD commit on that branch to a sha. If you provide a `sha` but no `branch`, branch caching will be disabled.
links.title: Create

_88build.title: Build

_88repository.description: the GitHub repository that this build is for

$eref.description: unique identifier of build
a compact identifier for an artifact the describes the repository and sha together

_88branch.description: the branch within the GitHub repository that the build was triggered from

_88repo_sha.description: a compact identifier for an artifact the describes the repository and sha together

_88state.description: the current state of the build

_88completed_at.description: when the build moved to the `"succeeded"` or `"failed"` state

_88started_at.description: when the build moved to the `"building"` state
